news_header: Kenya is facing a digital crackdown as the government targets AI-generated content and social media activism, leading to abductions of critics and a rise in online dissent.
news_original_title: Why Kenya is cracking down on viral AI-generated content
news_text: A silent war is unfolding in Kenya's digital landscape as the government intensifies its crackdown on AI-generated content and social media activism. This has led to a series of abductions targeting government critics, with reports of 82 cases since June 2024. Activists are using AI tools to create political imagery and protests, challenging the government's authority. While the government seeks to regulate social media and control the narrative, Kenya's vibrant online activism continues to grow, raising concerns about free speech and digital repression.
